text: Pope Victor III (; 1026-September 16, 1087), born Dauferius or Daufar, was an Italian cleric of the Roman Catholic Church and the 159th Pope from 1086 until his death in 1087. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2012-3-14. ==Early life== Dauferius was born in the Lombardy region of Italy."Pope Blessed Victor III," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2012-3-14. ==Benedictine== When Dauferius became a Benedictine monk, he took the name Desiderius. He became the abbot of Monte Cassino. ==Cardinal== In 1059, Abbot Desiderius was made a cardinal by Pope Stephen IX. ==Pope== Despite frail health, he was elected pope in 1086. ===After his death === In 1887, Victor was beatified by Pope Leo XIII.Starr, Brian D. (2006).
